intro: Phaedranassa multiflora, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of violet, pink, and white. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Phaedranassa multiflora thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its compact growth habit makes it ideal for indoor gardening and decorative arrangements.
